intro: Chaenesthes lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf chaenesthes, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its flowers are often brightly colored, ranging from red to purple, and attract various pollinators. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
